stories.original_summary: Einstein’s claim that the speed of light is constant has survived more than a century of scrutiny—but scientists are still daring to test it. stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards Seek to Challenge Elder Elara's Light Edict!
stories.fantasy_story: For over a century, Elder Elara's ancient teaching about the unchanging speed of light has been unchallenged. Yet, bold Wizards of the Arcanum Academy are now daring to test this sacred wisdom. They observe potent celestial bursts, hoping to glimpse if light behaves differently at the edges of the known realms.

stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards Uncover Magic That Defies Heating Charms!
stories.fantasy_story: Alchemists, studying tiny elemental sprites, applied focused luminous enchantments, expecting them to grow chaotic and burn. Instead, the sprites ceased absorbing the magical energy, locking into a wondrous, stable dance. This peculiar effect seems to stem from a deep, elemental harmony, challenging what was known about heating spells.

stories.fantasy_headline: Grand Exhibition Reveals New Magical Artifacts!
stories.fantasy_story: Each year, the desert city of Mirage hosts a grand exhibition where master craftsmen and ingenious guilds reveal their latest enchanted wares. From talking mirrors to self-moving carriages, an abundance of new magical devices are unveiled. The most wondrous artifacts receive special royal accolades, marking them as the marvels of the year.

stories.original_summary: Microsoft is making it a lot faster and easier to add links to text inside Word documents. Instead of having to open a menu item to insert a link or use the CTRL + K keyboard shortcut, you can now simply paste a link on top of the text you want to hyperlink. This new […]
stories.fantasy_headline: Scribes Discover Easier Way to Link Enchanted Parchments!
stories.fantasy_story: The venerable Scribe's Guild of Redmond has unveiled a clever new spell to create magical connections within illuminated scrolls. Instead of complex incantations or hidden glyphs, one can now simply place a whispering pathway onto chosen words. This makes linking scrolls together much swifter and less arcane for all scribes.
